channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Seeing Greene: Should I Start Flipping Houses in My Market? (How to Know)
item.description: Should I pay off my rentals or scale to more doors? Should I start flipping houses in my local but expensive market or go long-distance? When is the time to […]

item.title: OpenAI-backed legaltech startup Harvey raises $100M
item.description: Harvey, a startup building what it describes as an AI-powered “copilot” for lawyers, has raised $100 million in a Series C round led by GV, Google’s corporate venture arm. The tranche, which also had participation from heavy-hitting angels and VCs OpenAI, Kleiner Perkins, Sequoia Capital, Elad Gil and SV Angel, brings Harvey’s total raised to […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Five Things to Know About Kamala Harris’ Criminal Justice Record
item.description: Here’s where Vice President Kamala Harris, a former prosecutor, stands on important criminal justice issues.

item.title: 2 Money Moves We’re Making TODAY to Prepare for a Potential Recession
item.description: Are we in a recession? Are we headed for a recession? No one knows for certain, but you can never be too prepared for an economic downturn. Are you saving […]

item.title: Digital banking startup Mercury abruptly shuttered service for startups in Ukraine, Nigeria, other countries
item.description: Digital banking startup Mercury informed some founders that it is no longer serving customers in certain countries, including Ukraine. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Project 2025 Plans for Trump to Have Unprecedented Power Over the Justice Department
item.description: The policy plan for a second Trump term would turn the department against progressive local prosecutors.

item.title: Here’s Why Real Estate Investors Are Turning to ATMs For Diversification
item.description: As real estate conditions continue to tighten, investors are turning to ATMs for steady cash flow.

item.title: The next fintech to go public may not be the one you expected
item.description: Welcome to TechCrunch Fintech! This week, we’re looking at Human Interest’s path toward an IPO, fintech’s newest unicorn, a slew of new fundraises, and more. To get a roundup of TechCrunch’s biggest and most important fintech stories delivered to your inbox every Tuesday at 8:00 a.m. PT, subscribe here. item.title: Love Beyond Bars: Jules and Samantha
item.description: Jules and Samantha Werkheiser fought their wrongful convictions for over a decade. Here’s their journey of survival — and motherhood — in pictures.

item.title: Month Seven of Our 1031 Exchange: We’re Investing in… Restaurants?
item.description: With $975,000 to play with, we're looking at options outside of residential real estate.

item.title: The Waymo-Zeekr robotaxi has come to San Francisco
item.description: Waymo has started testing a new robotaxi built by Chinese electric automaker Zeekr on public roads in San Francisco. Waymo has “less than a handful” of the Zeekr vehicles in San Francisco today and isn’t driving them autonomously yet. Still, the fact that Waymo has hit the roads with a roomier, custom-built robotaxi signals the […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meet the New Generation of Unarmed First Responders in This New Podcast Series
item.description: “The Fifth Branch,” a podcast from The Marshall Project and Tradeoffs, examines new, alternative ways to respond to 911 crisis calls.

item.title: The Department of Justice’s Next Target: Buyer Agents
item.description: The DOJ is planning further changes to agent commission structures, which could lead to a significant reduction in traditional commission rates.

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Where Kamala Harris stands on tech issues
item.description: This weekend, President Biden announced that he would suspend his campaign for president, and he endorsed his vice president, Kamala Harris. We still don’t know if she will ultimately be the candidate that goes toe-to-toe with Donald Trump in November, but we do know that Silicon Valley has opinions. Like Trump’s VP pick J.D. item.title: What We Know About J.D. Vance’s Legislative Action on Criminal Justice
item.description: On immigration and more, Vance has defended and legislated former President Donald Trump’s policy goals.
